article.class: post-32384 page type-page status-publish hentry no-post-thumbnail

h5.span: School buildings will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to COVID-19.

em.strong: We will provide the latest information on this webpage, on social media, and through email. Bookmark this page to quickly get to the most current information from our district.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Governor Greg Abbott's Executive order issued today, April 17th, closed school buildings for the remainder of the 2020 school year due to COVID-19.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: We have built systems and structures to deliver learning online for the remainder of the year, and while we recognize this system is not perfect, it will allow us to successfully complete the year while we focus on our planning for the summer time frame and the reopening of school in August. Principals at each campus will continue to send you updates every Sunday evening on the process as well as any updates.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: The district has been planning for the possibility of a statewide closure. In the weeks ahead, the district and individual campuses will be sharing information to answer the questions our families, students, and staff have in this unprecedented closure of the buildings to include information about the gathering of medicines and personal belongings, collection of award certificates, kindergarten graduation, summer academic activities, community education, prom, graduation, and many others.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Preliminary plans have been made to postpone commencement exercises for the Class of 2020 into July. We are in the process of finalizing dates and possible locations for graduation. These will be announced soon.

span.span: Update #16 - April 17th (SCHOOL BUILDINGS CLOSED THROUGH END OF SCHOOL YEAR)

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Governor Greg Abbott's Executive order issued today, April 17th, closed school buildings for the remainder of the 2020 school year due to COVID-19.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: We have built systems and structures to deliver learning online for the remainder of the year, and while we recognize this system is not perfect, it will allow us to successfully complete the year while we focus on our planning for the summer time frame and the reopening of school in August. Principals at each campus will continue to send you updates every Sunday evening on the process as well as any updates.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: The district has been planning for the possibility of a statewide closure. In the weeks ahead, the district and individual campuses will be sharing information to answer the questions our families, students, and staff have in this unprecedented closure of the buildings to include information about the gathering of medicines and personal belongings, collection of award certificates, kindergarten graduation, summer academic activities, community education, prom, graduation, and many others.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Preliminary plans have been made to postpone commencement exercises for the Class of 2020 into July. We are in the process of finalizing dates and possible locations for graduation. These will be announced soon.

span.span: Update #15 - April 16th (SUMMER SCHOOL, PRE-K/KINDER REGISTRATION, HEALTH HERO CARD DRIVE, PLUS MORE)

div.p: FISD Parents,

As May 1st approaches, the district continues to communicate with local, regional, and state officials regarding the final three weeks of school. It is anticipated that the Governor will discuss future plans in the days ahead. FISD will carefully consider the health and safety of all as well as the recommendations and guidance from health officials before making further decisions about the remainder of the school year.

li.p: Friendswood Education Foundation - Health Hero Card Drive and #WeAreMighty

div.p: College Board SAT Information: College Board has released new information about SAT tests due to COVID-19- https://pages.collegeboard.org/sat-covid-19-updates

Secondary Summer School: Online registration for Summer School for students in grades 6 - 12 is now open. For more information about summer school please click the link. https://myfisd.com/hs/2020/04/summer-school/.

Mental Health Resource: COVID-19, isolation or social distancing can be stressful for many. Blue Refuge has shared a resource for students ages 13 - 17 who may be struggling with anxiety, depression during this time of isolation. https://www.bluerefuge.com/blue-refuge-blog-1/your-childs-mental-health-during-covid-19

PreK/Kinder Registration: Registration is underway for any students who will be PreK or Kindergarten in the Fall of 2020. It is important to capture initial information about our incoming students for the upcoming school year. Please click the link below to complete this first step if you have not already.

Registro de PreK / Kinder: El registro está en curso para cualquier estudiante que será PreK o Kindergarten en el otoño de 2020. Es importante capturar información inicial sobre nuestros estudiantes entrantes para el próximo año escolar. Haga clic en el enlace a continuación para completar este primer paso si aún no lo ha hecho.
PreK Link
Kindergarten Link

Free and Reduced Meal Application: We know some families may be struggling financially right now. Here is a link to our Food Services page where you can find detailed information to see if you qualify for Free and Reduced priced school meals. https://myfisd.com/food-service/. Please discuss any other issues or concerns you may be experiencing with your teacher. We may have services or resources we can offer.

FISD Cares: In the midst of this continuing COVID - 19 crisis, we are concerned about our students and their families. We have partnered with the Bay Area Alliance to form a program that is designed to help connect those in need with those who can best meet the need. If you are in a position to help others, consider becoming a potential donor by either contributing monetarily or with a specific service. You can make a donation or make contact on the FISD Cares website. You can also make a donation by texting FISDCares to 41444. https://fisdcares.com/

Health Hero Card Drive: FEF is kicking off a community-wide Health Hero Card Drive to show our local healthcare workers some love and encouragement. Cards are due by next Friday, April 24th and should be delivered to the #WeAreMighty Mailbox at 400 Woodlawn. Post a picture delivering your cards to help spread the word!

#WeAreMighty Merchandise: The official #WeAreMighty merchandise is live! Join us in spreading this movement of hope across our community with a fun new shirt, Texas-shaped yard sign, car decal, or all 3! Visit www.FISDFoundation.com and click the button at the top of the homepage to browse. All funds raised will support FISD employees and the second-order will close this Monday, April 20th at 11:59 PM.
#WeAreMighty Merchandise Flyer: PDF, JPEG

span.span: Update #14 - April 9th (PRE-K/KINDER REGISTRATION, MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES,#WEAREMIGHTY, ETC.)

div.p: This week’s update includes information about several resources for parents as well as confirmation of a waiver for Accountability. Just a reminder that this Friday, April 10, 2020, is a holiday for all students and staff. We hope you take this time to focus on what is important on this day with your family and take some time to breathe and rest for the days ahead. We appreciate all of you and your partnership with the district during this difficult time. Continue to do the best you can.

p.b: Meals will be handed out on Good Friday

div.p: Accountability/Assessment - The federal government has accepted the Texas waiver for all assessments and accountability requirements.. All districts and campuses will receive the label Not Rated: Declared State of Disaster for the 2019-20 school year. All schools and districts will keep the accountability ratings assigned in 2019.

Mental Health Resources - COVID-19 is a focus for everyone right now and with the isolation and drastic environmental changes occurring mental health may be declining in your home. We encourage you to keep the lines of communication open with your loved ones. Do not hesitate to reach out for help. Here are some resources for you and your family https://myfisd.com/sel/sel-resources/.

Meals to go: Food Service will continue to hand out breakfast and lunch to Free and Reduced students on Good Friday, April 10, 2020 at the regularly scheduled time from 10:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. at Bales Intermediate.

Virtual Board Meeting: The FISD Board of Trustees will hold our regularly scheduled board meeting Monday, April 13, 2020, at 6:30 pm. For more information or how to log on: https://www.smore.com/qvct5

Technology - FISD has distributed over 1,000 Chromebooks and provided several resources from local companies for internet access. We are grateful to this department for their tireless work during these first few weeks of distance learning. The Technology department has also distributed several resources for access by local vendors, also access to the internet is possible in parking lots of all FISD buildings. If your family is struggling with assignments because of internet access, please contact your child’s teacher to share the need. Teachers can then report the need for the technology department to try to assist with access.

We Are Mighty: The Friendswood Education Foundation has kicked off #WeAreMighty campaign in an effort to support FISD families in need. If you would like to purchase a shirt, yard sign or decal go to www.FISDFoundation.com. Funds from the sales of this merchandise will be used to support FISD staff and teachers.

Share your needs: If your family is struggling through this process academically, financially, mentally, and/or emotionally please communicate any issues with your child’s teacher, counselor or principal. There may be resources that FISD can provide to help. We cannot help if we do not know the need.

While district buildings are closed, Friendswood ISD's essential personnel for this evolving situation continue to consult with local health authorities and to convene virtually and regularly in order to conduct a full and ongoing assessment of risks for students and staff. As always, the safety of our students, staff, and families remains a top priority, and we will act out of an abundance of caution to protect everyone’s health and well-being.
For Ongoing support during this rapidly changing situation, visit Friendswood ISD COVID-19 Updates.

span.span: Update #13 - April 2nd (DISTANCE LEARNING, REGISTRATION, ACTIVITIES, TECHNOLOGY TIP, PLUS MORE)

p.span: Dear FISD Families,

Thank you for your hard work and support with distance learning. Another week of learning, frustration, joy, exhaustion and many more emotions have occurred this week and we are right there with you. With both the President of the United States and the Governor calling for an extension to social distancing through April 30th, we know we have to prepare for an extended period of working together to educate students. Continue to do the best you can to support this learning at home while caring for your own needs. We join with the Governor and others in asking that you continue to take time to be outdoors and utilize the time without formal activities to be together as a family. All current operations related to serving lunch to free and reduced students and providing technical support will continue through the entire period of the closure.
FISD updates include:
Health information from the State
Distance Learning
PreK/K Registration
Activities / Graduation Update
Communication with staff give 24-48 hours
State and Federal food and non-food benefits services
Friendswood Education Foundation Prize Patrol
Technology Tips for managing notifications

Health Information: Though we are apart right now for our health and safety, we at Friendswood ISD continue to support each other as a community, and right now we must work together to fight COVID-19. Friendswood ISD will be sharing vitally important guidance on social media and at https://myfisd.com/covid-19/ over the next couple of weeks.

This Guidance is based on what scientists know about how to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and it is our hope you will continue doing all you can to follow these practices and share them with your friends and family.

Thank you for what you are doing to educate your children at home and all the efforts you are making to keep your family healthy and safe. We know this is a difficult time. If we stand apart as a community during this stretch and continue to follow the public health practices we will be sharing on social media over the coming days, we will be back together soon.

Distance Learning: Please continue to monitor your email for campus communication regarding weekly Distance Learning Plans from your principals every Sunday evening at 6 p.m. These messages are campus-specific and are updated each week.

PreK/K Registration: FISD will be launching "Step 1" of Spring PreK and Kindergarten Registration starting April 15 to capture initial information about our incoming students for the 2020-2021 school year. A link will be shared via email, social media and on all campus websites starting April 15th. This is a very important process for us as we plan for next year.

Activities and Graduation Update: Though we continue to have hope, much uncertainty remains as to the ability to return back to school or even gather in groups for activities after May 4th should we return to school. Venues are making cancellation decisions and securing new venues at different dates in this environment is problematic. Campuses will provide communication on future events as this situation continues to unfold. The high school is working on alternate graduation plans for later dates should the current date not be possible because of health concerns. We want to celebrate our seniors even if it is later in the year in the safest manner possible. These will be shared as plans finalize.

Communication with Staff: Your emails are important to us and we want to answer any questions you may have with helpful responses and in a timely manner. Please allow FISD staff 24 - 48 hours to respond to your emails.

State and Federal Food and Non-Food Benefit Services: Hunger Free Texans have continued to be in contact with both State and Federal Agencies regarding minimizing the impact of the CoronaVirus Emergency to our Texas Counties. Click HERE for important timely information regarding feeding and non-feeding programs and services.

Friendswood Education Foundation #WeAreMighty: In the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey #FriendswoodStrong quickly became an anthem that echoed hope across our community. We saw our community rise up like never before to love and support our neighbors. We saw the power of a battle cry of hope. As we face the COVID-19 pandemic, we know we will get through this the same way...together. We’re not just strong. Together we are MIGHTY. Use #WeAreMighty on social media to be a part of the movement of hope, resilience, and strength across our community.

Virtual SurPrize Patrol: FEF's SurPrize Patrol is going virtual TOMORROW, April 3rd to award grants throughout FISD! Follow along on the Friendswood ISD Education Foundation Facebook Page and like, comment, and share to spread the SurPrize Patrol fun! Post pictures and videos of you and your family cheering on your teachers as we go. "RSVP" to the event here! All SurPrize Patrol videos will be posted on the FISD YouTube Channel tomorrow afternoon.

Technology Tips and Hints: We have heard some of you are overwhelmed with the number of notifications regarding assignments coming from Canvas. The Technology Department has shared a very helpful video from FHS teacher Ms. Rizzi to manage your notifications from teachers in Canvas by clicking HERE.

While district buildings are closed, Friendswood ISD's essential personnel for this evolving situation continue to consult with local health authorities and to convene virtually and regularly in order to conduct a full and ongoing assessment of risks for students and staff. As always, the safety of our students, staff, and families remains a top priority, and we will act out of an abundance of caution to protect everyone’s health and well-being.
For ongoing support during this rapidly changing situation, visit Friendswood ISD COVID-19 Updates.
Today Governor Greg Abbott ordered schools to extend the suspension of normal operations until Monday, May 4th in an effort to support the nation’s need to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Houston area continues to see an increasing number of confirmed cases of COVID-19. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol.

The health of FISD students, staff and community is the District’s top priority and District leaders are working to ensure the community has the most current information available in this rapidly changing situation.
FISD will be sending out our regularly scheduled district communication update Thursday, April 2, 2020, via email.

span.p: Update #11 - March 26th (LAWS, TECHNOLOGY, MEALS, CANCELLATIONS, ETC.)

p.span: Dear FISD Families:

We are working hard to support our students, parents, and staff during in-home distance learning. We do not want to overwhelm parents with information. Therefore, we plan to send out district weekly communication every Thursday.
In this update, you’ll find information regarding:
Galveston County Stay-home-work-safe Order
Student technology help desk
Free Internet service for families & Friendswood ISD expanded WiFI access
Free and Reduced lunch applications
Meals to Community
Updating email and phone info on Skyward
Bond Election moved to November 3, 2020
STAAR/EOC Cancellation
SAT / AP adjustments
Social-Emotional Canvas Page
UIL Activities

Galveston County Stay-home-work-safe Order: Galveston county instituted a stay-at-home order that began at 11:59 p.m Tuesday. The order will remain in effect until April 3. FISD schools will continue to function as Closed Instructing. The order permits the continuation of meals for free and reduced lunch students, deliveries essential to the continuity of the educational process, and technology assistance. We will continue to monitor the guidelines set forth by Texas Education Agency and Galveston County and will continue to update you as information becomes available.

Student technology help desk: If you are experiencing technical issues with FISD Chromebooks, Canvas, Skyward or just need general help with technology, please email [email protected]. Please be patient. Our technology team may be experiencing high numbers. They will get back to you as soon as possible.

Free Internet service available & FISD WiFi access expanded: We recently shared resources for families to gain access to the Internet at home. Please see our resources if you missed those releases: Internet Access for Distance Learning

Free and Reduced Lunch Applications: FISD will continue to feed all free and reduced students lunches each day at Bales. Meals are served 10:30 – 12:30 Monday-Friday through Friday for the remainder of the COVID-19 closure. Applications to apply for the free/reduced program are available at https://myfisd.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/2019-2020-Application.pdf and in the meal line at Bales. Completed applications should be returned to FISD Food Service staff in the meal line at Bales during serving hours.
Community meals for those in need: Friendswood Rotary, The City of Friendswood and Friendswood Youth Baseball Organization will be serving meals for Senior Citizens and families in need.
To apply online for meal delivery click here: https://varcsolutions.quickbase.com/db/bqdzxp2buhttps://varcsolutions.quickbase.com/db/bqdzxp2bu

Parents Updating Email and phone numbers in Skyward: Please make sure your email and phone numbers are updated in your Skyward Family Access Account. Once it is updated in Skyward it will be updated in Canvas overnight.
Go to Family Access and then click on Skylert. Make any changes and click Save. (See screenshot)

Board Meeting Information: Per the Governor’s order, elections for May 2nd could be rescheduled until November. Once a bond election has been called, it cannot be canceled. Based on the current COVID-19 situation, on Monday night the Board voted unanimously to reschedule May 2, 2020, Bond Election until November 3, 2020.

STAAR/EOC Cancellation: Governor Greg Abbott has waived the State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness (STAAR) testing requirements for the 2019-2020 school year. Additionally, Governor Abbott is requesting that the Department of Education (DOE) waive federal testing requirements for the 2019-2020 school year.

Grade 5 and 8 promotion/retention requirements are also waived for the 2019-2020 school year. Districts will have local discretion on whether students in grades 5 and 8 should advance to the next grade, just like students in all other grades. Graduating seniors that needed to pass EOC tests may graduate through the Individual Graduation Committee (IGC) process regardless of the number of EOCs needed. Students who successfully complete and earn credit in an EOC course during the 2019-2020 school year will not have the corresponding EOC assessment as part of their graduation requirements. Although the TELPAS window has been extended, at this time FISD will not be participating. TEA is working on alternate exit criteria for English Learners this year.

At this point, we are not planning to administer any state assessments this school year. We will utilize available resources next fall for diagnostic assessments. We are awaiting further guidance from TEA for our English Learners as to exit criteria for these students.
SAT and AP Testing: All AP/SAT testing information will be sent via email from FHS. If you did not receive this information please contact Glen Newsom at [email protected]

Social-Emotional Learning Canvas Page: a campus level course is being created for all students and staff. Counselors will be posting items such as video messages, articles, activities and learning opportunities. They will use canvas as the vehicle to continue sharing their content as they would if school was in session.
UIL Activities: Given the information related to school closures, the UIL has suspended all activities until May 4th.

While district buildings are closed, Friendswood ISD's essential personnel for this evolving situation continue to consult with local health authorities and to convene virtually and regularly in order to conduct a full and ongoing assessment of risks for students and staff. As always, the safety of our students, staff, and families remains a top priority, and we will act out of an abundance of caution to protect everyone’s health and well-being.
For ongoing support during this rapidly changing situation, visit: Friendswood ISD COVID-19 Updates.

span.p: Update #10 - March 24th (STUDENT TESTS POSITIVE FOR COVID-19)

div.span: The Galveston County Health District has provided the following information to FISD:

span.em: A student between the age of 5-10-years-old that attends Friendswood ISD has tested positive for COVID-19 on March 20, 2020. The student was not experiencing symptoms while at school, only developing symptoms during Spring Break. Because of this student's illness onset, there was no exposure to students or staff. The Galveston County Health District is notifying all of his/her other contacts. Due to privacy laws, the GCHD is unable to provide further details.

p.span: According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person through close contact, within about six feet, through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes. Some spread might be possible before people show symptoms, but this is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads. Please contact your physician if you have questions regarding any risk of exposure or if you or your student develop any symptoms consistent with COVID-19 such as fever, cough, and difficulty breathing.
Prevention continues to be the best protection for this as well as reducing your risk of contracting other respiratory illnesses such as influenza.

li.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with the inside of your elbow or a tissue and throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

p.span: You can find more information regarding COVID-19 by visiting the CDC’s website. For more information visit the Galveston County Health District Website.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: FISD Parents,

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Good morning. We hope you are doing well. We wanted to give you an update on what to expect for the week of March 23 - 27.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Principals will be communicating information regarding distance learning plans for students Sunday evening at 6 pm via email. Teachers will have plans loaded on Canvas no later than Monday morning at 9 a.m.

span.style: font-family: garamond, times new roman, serif; font-size: large;

p.span: Please continue to communicate with your teachers should questions arise regarding learning expectations.

div.p: Dear FISD Parents,

Good evening. You should have all received an email from your campus principals with guidance on how teachers will be rolling out instructional opportunities or activities for learning over the next several weeks. In an effort to keep you informed and simplify the process as much as possible, campus principals will be sharing updates for the week ahead every Sunday evening at 6 pm via email.
We want to make sure you are getting the support you need. Here is a list of resources that may help as you navigate this new concept of “family learning”.
Questions on:
Canvas how-to: https://myfisd.com/16canvas/
Tech support (can’t open/what is my password, etc.): please email [email protected]
Instructional Support with activities: Email your teacher via Canvas
CDC COVID-19 Information: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
All FISD Updates/Statements: https://myfisd.com/covid-19/
Social-Emotional Support for students: Coming Soon to Canvas!
How to Canvas, Clever and Google info is here: https://sites.google.com/a/fisdk12.net/fisd-online-textbooks/how-to-s-tips-tricks?

We realize not everyone feels comfortable using social media. However, teachers, campuses, and Friendswood ISD are sharing many creative lessons, how-tos and “read alongs” on Facebook right now to help families stay engaged. Suggestion: If you want a social media account, for this reason, we suggest you simply limit the number of pages you follow or “like”. Here is a full list of FISD social media pages.
Thank you for your continued support of our students and schools,
Friendswood ISD

span.span: Update #7 - March 16th (VIDEO MESSAGE FROM SUP ROHER)

p.a: A video message from Superintendent Roher (watch here).

div.p: Friendswood ISD is joining with regional school districts to extend the suspension of normal district operations through Friday, April 10th in an effort to support the nation’s need to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Houston area continues to see an increasing number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 and health officials report that this number is expected to continue to increase as more testing is made available.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has outlined the need for all communities to implement a social distancing protocol. The President has publicly shared that the community should not gather in groups larger than 10 people.

Soon you will be receiving instructions from your campus principal on supporting your children instructionally while at home. Please continue to monitor your email and social media channels for more information on plans to deliver instructional support.

The health of FISD students, staff and community is the District’s top priority and District leaders are working to ensure the community has the most current information available in this rapidly changing situation.
Dear FISD Parents,

Prior to Spring Break, we asked for parents to share travel plans for students that were traveling outside of the United States. So much has changed for all of us since that time. As we prepare for the weeks ahead, it is important to get accurate information on the travel of our students over spring break. To capture this information, we ask that any of you that traveled outside of the United States or took a cruise over the break click on the link below and fill out the travel form. Thank you for your prompt attention and your cooperation. Please complete as soon as possible.

FISD will offer free curbside, take-home breakfast and lunch March 16-20, for all qualified free and reduced students. St meals consisting of a packaged lunch and a breakfast meal for the next day will be available daily at Bales (211 Stadium Lane) from 10:30 am-12:30 pm.

Friendswood ISD ofrecerá desayuno y almuerzo gratis (para recoger) en el estacionamiento de Bales, cada dia para la próxima semana (del 16 al 20 de marzo) para todos los estudiantes calificados del almuerzo gratis o de precio reducido. Las comidas de los estudiantes que consisten en un almuerzo empaquetado y una comida de desayuno para el día siguiente estarán disponibles diariamente para recoger en estacamiemto de Bales Intermediate (211 Stadium Lane) de 10:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m.
In order to help prevent the broader spread of COVID-19, Friendswood ISD is joining with districts across the region in closing next week, March 16-20. All school activities/events will be canceled.
Continue to closely monitor communication from the district for additional information for both parents and FISD employees.

We hope you are having a good Spring Break! FISD is continuing to closely monitor information concerning coronavirus (COVID-19) and follow the guidance and expertise of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Galveston County Health Department and Texas Department of State Health Services.

FISD has a scheduled conference call Friday afternoon with the greater Houston area school districts and State Health Services as well as meeting with Harris County Health officials to discuss strategic planning for the return of staff and students after Spring Break. We will update our staff and parents of FISD’s plan for a safe transition after this call.
Dear Friendswood ISD Families,

The District is aware of a recent national news article where Dr. Nancy Messonnier, the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) director of the National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, encouraged parents to call school districts regarding plans in the event of a possible coronavirus outbreak.

At this time, we would like to remind parents and families that Friendswood ISD actively monitors for potential health issues within the District. Additionally, the District is working closely with the CDC, the Texas Department of State and Health Services, local governments, and health care providers across Galveston County to prepare for and respond to any potential coronavirus situation.
As of February 25, 2020, there have been no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Galveston County and the health risk to the general public remains low.

Should a need arise for the District to take action on any aspect of our district health and safety plan, we will inform parents and families through all District communications channels and local media.

Currently, we are seeing flu cases in our schools. Parents and guardians can assist the District in preventing the spread of illness by not sending students to school if they know their child is not feeling well or has a confirmed diagnosis. Be mindful of the “24-hour rule” that states a student cannot return to school until free of fever, vomiting, or diarrhea, without the use of medications, for 24 hours. Flu can be contagious for 5-7 days after you start feeling sick.
For further information related to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) we ask parents to visit the following sources of information as it relates to the disease.
Common Flu: Guidelines for parents of children or adolescents with chronic health conditions:
Thank you,
Thad Roher
Superintendent of Friendswood ISD

hr.a: CDC – Centers for disease control and prevention
Texas Department of State Health Services

strong.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: inherit; font-size: 1em; letter-spacing: 0em;

em.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: inherit; font-size: 1em; letter-spacing: 0em;

p.em: Friendswood ISD follows the guidance and expertise of national and local health officials to help protect our students and staff from all communicable diseases. The District is aware that The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is monitoring an outbreak of respiratory illness (COVID-19) caused by a novel (new) coronavirus. Families are encouraged to visit CDC website for more information and travel guidance regarding the Coronavirus.
We continue to be in communication with our local partners and stand ready to take all appropriate measures.

div.p: As a reminder, the CDC always recommends everyday preventive actions to help prevent the spread of respiratory viruses, including:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Stay home when you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
